titleStmt.title: The out-cries of the poor, oppressed, & imprisoned; or A safe way to free the poor of this city and the whole nation of England, from begging and starving. Presented to the Council of Officers, Nov. 24. by William Pryor, and Thomas Turner. To which is annexed, A plea for the poor and helpless, against the enemies of their peace. By William Pryor.
titleStmt.author: Pryor, William.

titleStmt.title: The out-cries of the poor, oppressed, & imprisoned; or A safe way to free the poor of this city and the whole nation of England, from begging and starving. Presented to the Council of Officers, Nov. 24. by William Pryor, and Thomas Turner. To which is annexed, A plea for the poor and helpless, against the enemies of their peace. By William Pryor.
titleStmt.author: Pryor, William.
Turner, Thomas, advocate of reform.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by G.D. for Francis Smith, and are to be sold at his shop, at the Elephant and Castle near Temple-Bar,
